About

About

As Software becomes easier to build, it also becomes harder to secure. Software should not be trusted and should be properly controlled so that it only does what it is programmed to.

Intrinsic lets you least-privilege web-applications and automatically enforce very fine-grained security policies directly on the language runtime.

Retake control of your infrastructure – avoid problems like leftpad – and stop worrying about unknown vulnerabilities, developer mistakes or malicious code.

Intrinsic is formed by a group of security, systems, programming languages engineers and Stanford & UCSD Computer Professors. This is some earlier research we have done in the space: COWL, Hails. Intrinsic is funded by NEA, Andreessen Horowitz, First Round Capital and Stanford University.

Intrinsic is currently in private beta for Node.js only.
Iterested in trying it out? Sign up!
